According to the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Development regulations, the total number of employees in the entity stands for all employees, whether Saudi or non-Saudi, hired permanently or temporarily.
The total number of employees in the entity

The International Standard Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC4) is a global classification standard used to identify the economic activities of establishments. To determine the economic activity of an establishment in Nitaqat, select its corresponding ISIC4 code.
Compare with the expected Nitaqat if the number of employees changes

string.name: hyperLinkDesc
string.u: What is Nitaqat and how is it calculated?

resources.string: Therefore, Qiwa made it easier to calculate the end-of-service reward amount, the due date of the reward, and how to calculate it according to the rules of the Saudi labor system.

The end-of-service reward is the employee’s rights over the employer in the event of terminating the contractual relationship. The Saudi legislator obliges the employer to pay it to the employee at the end of the work contract, whether the work contract is for a limited period or an unlimited period.
The entity’s Nitaqat corresponds to the Nationalization rate, which is based on economic activity.
The Nitaqat level and the Nationalization rate are calculated based on the number of Saudi and non-Saudi employees in the entity.
With the Nitaqat calculator, business owners can analyze their establishments\' current or future performance in the labor market.
The National ID/Iqama field must contain exactly 10 digits.
Check the calculator for Saudi labor market regulation program.
Validate certificates for your establishment, including the Nationalization Certificate.
View a list of occupations related to economic activities.
Calculate the total fee for work permits and determine the number of exempt workers.
Allowed quota (current balance of Employee Transfers and Visas)
Contract period expired, or agreement between both parties to end contract
pending employee transfer requests, employees in the Ajeer program, and unused visas.
This calculation is only an estimate and doesn\'t take into account:
special cases such as employees with special needs, part-time workers, or students,
